Iron Chunk.name: Iron Chunk
Iron Chunk.desc: This iron chunk can be turned into a multitude of handy items in the hands of a skilled craftsman.
Iron Chunk.longDesc: This iron ore can be turned into a multitude of handy items in the hands of a skilled craftsman. Mineral ores' presence on the surface usually indicates abundant ore veins underneath.

White Iron Chunk.name: White Iron Chunk
White Iron Chunk.desc: Skilled hands can make this into something brilliant.
White Iron Chunk.longDesc: This white iron ore can be turned into a variety of splendid items in the hands of a skilled craftsman. It is suffused with memories of battles fought across the land, which makes it a great material for crafting weapons.

Crystal Chunk.name: Crystal Chunk
Crystal Chunk.desc: An uncut crystal. Only professional craftsmanship can bring out its true value.
Crystal Chunk.longDesc: An uncut crystal. Only professional craftsmanship can bring out its true value. This kind of limpid rock is a precious gift of the land, which can be utilized as a valuable weapon-making material.

Magical Crystal Chunk.name: Magical Crystal Chunk
Magical Crystal Chunk.desc:
These crystal chunks can be refined into Weapon EXP materials by using Original Resin.
Crystals from mines that were eroded by the energy of the Ley Lines cannot be processed by ordinary means.

Starsilver.name: Starsilver
Starsilver.desc: A rare and precious ore formed by the unique geographical conditions and Ley Lines of Dragonspine.

Amethyst Lump.name: Amethyst Lump
Amethyst Lump.desc: An uncut crystal that can only be found in Inazuma. Some professional craftsmanship will bring out its true value.

Apple.name: Apple
Apple.desc: Crisp and fragrant. Delicious raw or made into wine.
Apple.longDesc: Crisp and fragrant. Delicious raw or fermented into wine. Can be also made into a refreshing alcohol-free beverage.

Sunsettia.name: Sunsettia
Sunsettia.desc: A plump fruit, beautiful like the sunset, that is abundant across all of Teyvat. It has a curious, sweet aroma and is able to energize an individual.

Mushroom.name: Mushroom
Mushroom.desc: Hardy common fungi. Can grow anywhere with the right amount of shade and moisture.

Sweet Flower.name: Sweet Flower
Sweet Flower.desc: Particularly fragrant flowers. They can be found easily, even in the dark. Just follow the scent.
Sweet Flower.longDesc: Particularly fragrant flowers. They can be easily located, even in the dark, thanks to their sweet scent. Commonly used in Teyvat to make sugar.

Carrot.name: Carrot
Carrot.desc: A healthy and nutritious vegetable that is crunchy and sweet to the taste. Easy to grow and harvest.

Radish.name: Radish
Radish.desc: Rich in fiber and nutrients. Easy to grow and harvest.

Snapdragon.name: Snapdragon
Snapdragon.desc: Can be eaten once cooked. As a spice, it can bring wonderful flavor to dishes.
sources: Found near lakes and river banks

Mint.name: Mint
Mint.desc: A refreshingly cool ingredient. The cool, fresh flavor can cut through the heat of many dishes.
Mint.longDesc: A refreshingly cool ingredient. The cool, fresh flavor can cut through the heat of many dishes. Mint is readily available throughout the land and is known for its exuberant vitality.

Pinecone.name: Pinecone
Pinecone.desc: Filled with oil-rich seeds. Certainly won't be growing into a tree from inside a squirrel's stomach.

Berry.name: Berry
Berry.desc: Small, brightly-colored fruit. They can be found everywhere, and the taste of them wipes the fatigue of a long journey away.

Matsutake.name: Matsutake
Matsutake.desc: A rare fungus that generally grows on or near pine trees. Its delicate aroma gives away its location.

Bird Egg.name: Bird Egg
Bird Egg.desc: An incredibly versatile ingredient that can supply all of your daily protein needs.

Seagrass.name: Seagrass
Seagrass.desc: A plant that grows in shallow seas. It adds a unique flavor to dishes.

Lavender Melon.name: Lavender Melon
Lavender Melon.desc: A brightly-colored fruit. The flesh within transforms into food with a unique mouthfeel when cooked.
Lavender Melon.longDesc:
A fruit with gorgeous skin. The flesh within transforms into food with a unique mouthfeel when cooked.
In Inazuma, there is a traditional art that involves using the outer skins of these fruits to make dye. They say that Konda Village once planted Lavender Melons and that they were famed for their secret "Konda Dye" art, by which they produced truly lovely fabric.
sources: Found in the wild in Inazuma

Wolfhook.name: Wolfhook
Wolfhook.desc: A berry with thorns that often gets attached to a wolf's pelt. When you look at it, you can almost hear the echoing cries of the wolves in the woods.
Wolfhook.longDesc: A berry with thorns that often gets attached to a wolf's pelt. When you look at it, you can almost hear the echoing cries of the wolves in the woods. Wolfhook has medicinal properties useful in treating minor illnesses. Although, in its original form, it can also harm careless people or animals...

Valberry.name: Valberry
Valberry.desc: A plump and translucent berry that has a fragrant smell and a sweet, refreshing taste. In the past, the storm watchers' only solace was the sweetness of this fruit and hope for the city's peace.

Cecilia.name: Cecilia
Cecilia.desc: A beautiful flower with a name that suits its appearance. It only grows where harsh winds blow, and is just as intangible as the true heart of an unbound soul.

Windwheel Aster.name: Windwheel Aster
Windwheel Aster.desc: A plant that adores the wind. To the proud children of the wind, or the citizens of Mondstadt, the Windwheel Asters are "the visible winds."
sources: Found near the Statue of The Seven at Windrise
Found under trees in the wild

Philanemo Mushroom.name: Philanemo Mushroom
Philanemo Mushroom.desc: A fungus that grows in the warm caress of the wind. It is as everlasting as the wind, nourishing life.
sources: Found under the eaves of houses

Small Lamp Grass.name: Small Lamp Grass
Small Lamp Grass.desc: A wild grass that emits light at night. Used in cooking to enhance other flavors.
Small Lamp Grass.longDesc: A wild grass that emits light at night. Used in cooking to enhance other flavors. Just as the subtle fragrance of wild flowers will not distract a focused person, Small Lamp Grass' delicate glow will not attract their attention either, even at night.
sources: Found in the wild at night
Recommendation: Found in the Whispering Woods

Calla Lily.name: Calla Lily
Calla Lily.desc: A flower that grows near water sources. When cooked, the petals have a chunky texture, yet are sweet and a little bitter.
Calla Lily.longDesc: A flower that grows near water sources. When cooked, the petals have a chunky texture, yet are sweet and a little bitter. Modern medicine recognizes Calla Lily's antidotal properties, but its astringent flavor is repulsive to many people.

Strange Tooth.name: Strange Tooth
Strange Tooth.desc: A Dragontooth you picked up in Dragonspine. Perhaps someone would know something more about it...

Vitalized Dragontooth.name: Vitalized Dragontooth
Vitalized Dragontooth.desc: A Dragontooth infused with vitality. Just its luster and texture are enough to make one uneasy...
Vitalized Dragontooth.longDesc:
A Dragontooth that has absorbed vitality and now exudes a warmth that makes one uneasy. Once upon a time, a dragon fell to ruin in a silver valley, painting the bone-white snow an ominous crimson. This crimson symbolizes the might of this dragon.
This Dragontooth wrapped in that crimson may yet be forged into a deadly weapon...

Lotus Head.name: Lotus Head
Lotus Head.desc: An aquatic plant native to Liyue that grows and blooms in pairs. One is fragrant, and the other bitter. It's said to make a good herbal medicine.
sources: Found near lakes and river banks

Jueyun Chili.name: Jueyun Chili
Jueyun Chili.desc: A spicy plant native to Liyue. Merely smelling it makes one hot and thirsty.
Jueyun Chili.longDesc:
A spicy plant native to Liyue. Merely smelling it makes one hot and thirsty. Despite "Jueyun" being a part of its name, it does not usually grow in Jueyun Karst.
The name seems to originate from its spiciness, which makes people want to run to the highest peaks of Jueyun and cool their mouths with chilly air.

Noctilucous Jade.name: Noctilucous Jade
Noctilucous Jade.desc: A rare mineral that glimmers in the dark. It's said to be a mutated gemstone condensed from the flourishing elements of the world.

Silk Flower.name: Silk Flower
Silk Flower.desc: A crimson flower that blooms like the rainbow clouds in Liyue. It can be made into silky-smooth fabric.
Silk Flower.longDesc: A crimson flower that blooms like the rainbow clouds in Liyue. It can be made into silky-smooth fabric. Liyue's Feiyun Commerce Guild is a giant in silk and textile manufacturing. Legend has it that Feiyun Commerce Guild has a secret Silk Flower nursery somewhere in the mainland. Nobody in the industry can rival their yield and texture.
sources: Found near Yujing Terrace, Liyue Harbor

Glaze Lily.name: Glaze Lily
Glaze Lily.desc: An extremely ancient flower that was said to be commonly seen in Liyue. It transforms the memories of the land into its fragrance during florescence.
Glaze Lily.longDesc: An extremely ancient flower, said to have once been a common sight in Liyue. It transforms the memories of the land into its fragrance during florescence. Legend has it that the flower will open at the sound of pure, beautiful music, and that there was once one who loved this flower more than any other. Now, however, the sight of a Glaze Lily in full bloom out in the wild is a rare one indeed.
sources: Recommendation: Found in Yujing Terrace, Liyue Harbor

Qingxin.name: Qingxin
Qingxin.desc: A translucent white flower that only grows on the highest stone peaks. It eschews the warmth and moisture of the plains to gaze out afar from the solitary mountaintops.
sources: Found in the heights of stone forests
Recommendation: Found in Guyun Stone Forest

Horsetail.name: Horsetail
Horsetail.desc: A purple plant that sometimes grows amidst Silvergrass but grows taller, straighter, and plumper â€” like an aristocrat among the paupers.
sources: Found in patches of Silvergrass and wetlands

Starconch.name: Starconch
Starconch.desc: Empty seashells brought ashore by the tides. Hold it close to your ear, and hear the longing calls of the sea.
sources: Found on the beaches of Liyue

Violetgrass.name: Violetgrass
Violetgrass.desc: A small flower with strong vitality. It is said that its downward-blooming flower keeps its fragrance from dissipating.

Bamboo Shoot.name: Bamboo Shoot
Bamboo Shoot.desc: A fresh young bamboo shoot, straight out of the ground. It is a delicious cooking ingredient with an exotic aroma, found exclusively in bamboo-growing regions.
sources: Recommendation: Found in the bamboo forest near Qingce Village

Sakura Bloom.name: Sakura Bloom
Sakura Bloom.desc: Blossoms from the Sacred Sakura at the Grand Narukami Shrine, filled with a fondness for Inazuma.
Sakura Bloom.longDesc:
A petal that has fallen from the Grand Narukami Shrine's Sacred Sakura. They float in mid-air due to the effect of Electro energies.
Legend holds that the roots of Thunder Sakura are linked deep beneath the earth. Should you trace these roots, you will always come back to this sacred sakura tree that stands guard over Inazuma. Some other legends have it that the Thunder Sakura are part of the Almighty Narukami Ogosho, the result of her splitting her divine form into parts, all the better to defend those under her rule with.

Onikabuto.name: Onikabuto
Onikabuto.desc: A strange beetle that inhabits areas rich with Electro energy. Its docile and sedentary temperament could not be more different from the fierce, demonic visage displayed on its armored shell.
Onikabuto.longDesc:
A strange beetle that inhabits areas rich with Electro energy. Its docile and sedentary temperament could not be more different from the fierce, demonic visage displayed on its armored shell.
Inazuman folktales say that when the gods were apportioning territory to the many animals, the onikabuto, who detested conflict, chose first to live in lands saturated in Electro. As many years passed, it evolved bizarre patterns with which to frighten trespassers and developed horns that could release electricity to deter predators. Yet though it wears armor and bears horns, the onikabuto hates fighting most of all animals.

Crystal Marrow.name: Crystal Marrow
Crystal Marrow.desc: A crystal that contains a sliver of Tatarigami power. Adding this material during smelting will greatly increase the strength and toughness of metals.
Crystal Marrow.longDesc:
A crystal that contains a sliver of Tatarigami power. Adding this material during smelting will greatly increase the strength and toughness of metals.
In Inazuma, "Tatarigami" refers to the corpse of a divine being and the strange phenomena it creates. They say that before the god that created Crystal Marrow became the Tatarigami, it had many names, one of which was "Orobashi no Mikoto." Orobashi no Mikoto's body was as long as the winding seashore, and its voice was so resounding that only the Dark Sea could absorb it. Yet in the end, it too was cut down together with Yashiori Island itself.

Sea Ganoderma.name: Sea Ganoderma
Sea Ganoderma.desc: A plant species that only grows in certain regions and islands of the ocean. Though it looks like a fungus of some sort, it actually comes from a substance secreted by certain soft-bodied organisms.
Sea Ganoderma.longDesc:
A plant species that only grows in certain regions and islands of the ocean. Though it looks like a fungus of some sort, it actually comes from a substance secreted by certain soft-bodied organisms.
In the folktales told in a certain land, these mouthless, noseless creatures are the transformed souls of children who died young. As a form of punishment, they must spend endless years absorbing the elements within the sand and sea using their fragile bodies, piling them up and forming "Sea Ganoderma." And once the Ganoderma are fully formed, they shall be harvested.

Naku Weed.name: Naku Weed
Naku Weed.desc: Even on windless days, this plant will tremble lightly amid the cries of thunder. The parts of it that resemble petals are in fact extensions of the leaves meant to protect the fragile flower.
Naku Weed.longDesc:
Even on windless days, this plant will tremble lightly amid the cries of thunder. The parts of it that resemble petals are in fact extensions of the leaves meant to protect the fragile flower.
The Naku Weed grows strongly in areas saturated with Electro energy. Due to its great affinity for lightning, it is often used by residents to predict storms. Stories tell that these plants are what the bake-danuki Ioroi stole from the Shogun's very own garden using its powers, before planting them throughout the islands. Even long after its punishment and disappearance, people still speak of Ioroi's many deeds.

Dendrobium.name: Dendrobium
Dendrobium.desc: A vibrant plant that has also been named the "lycoris" by the poets. It was once thought extinct in the Inazuman archipelago, only to re-emerge now upon the battlefields. It is said that it blooms most enchantingly where much blood was spilled.
Dendrobium.longDesc:
A vibrant plant that has also been named "lycoris" by the poets. It was once thought extinct in the Inazuman archipelago, only to re-emerge now upon the battlefields. It is said that it blooms most enchantingly where much blood was spilled.
Though it is very rare and expensive, this plant is regarded as ominous, and thus is little purchased. Rumor has it that these plants are watered using blood. The bloodier and more brutal the battlefield, the more lovely the dendrobium blooms shall be. Inazumans believe that the souls of the fallen shall follow the winding paths of the bloodied dendrobiums into the next life, thus rejoining the eternal elemental cycle. But as for those who doubt or are perplexed by "eternity," they shall be shackled to the earth, becoming another enchantingly red flower amid the vermillion fields.

Amakumo Fruit.name: Amakumo Fruit
Amakumo Fruit.desc: The fruit of the Amakumo Grass, which grows on Seirai Island. You can hear it crackling with a tiny current if you hold it up to your ear.
Amakumo Fruit.longDesc:
The fruit of the Amakumo Grass, which grows on Seirai Island. You can hear it crackling with a tiny current if you hold it up to your ear.
The Amakumo Grass was born when the terrible slaughter that tore through Seirai Island, causing it to ever be under a stormy shroud, ended. As if showing its defiance, it will bear fruit while facing the peals of thunder from the sky.
This bold spirit also accompanied those who emigrated to Seirai Island, until Koseki Village was at last ruined and no clergy-person was left to man the Asase Shrine.

Sango Pearl.name: Sango Pearl
Sango Pearl.desc: A precious pearl that grows in the coral of Watatsumi. Gives off a cool sheen like that of the moonlight.
Sango Pearl.longDesc:
These pearls only grow alongside the coral of Watatsumi, and they will emit a cooling sensation in your palm as gentle as a moonbeam.
Some local stories say that if held by a person in whose veins runs the blood of Watatsumi, these pearls will become brighter still, for these pearls are the blood that Watatsumi Omikami shed for its people. Other legends say that the great Omikami used a pearl as bright as the moon to shine upon Enkanomiya, leading the people who dwelt there up to the surface. As such, the Sango Pearls are akin to sacred relics to some.
The "pearls and waves" of the Sangonomiya emblem are said to come from these very waves that embraced Watatsumi and the bright gem that gave it light.

Fluorescent Fungus.name: Fluorescent Fungus
Fluorescent Fungus.desc: A mushroom that glows like a night-light. Some curious power lies hidden within it.
Fluorescent Fungus.longDesc: A mushroom that glows like a night-light. Some curious power lies hidden within it. Amidst the fog that blankets Tsurumi Island, these Fluorescent Fungi can help to light the way.

Fir Wood.name: Fir Wood
Fir Wood.desc:
Wood from the tree known as "Faber's Fir." Widely used for its fine quality and attractive grain.
Can be used to create furnishings.

Yumemiru Wood.name: Yumemiru Wood
Yumemiru Wood.desc:
Timber obtained from Sakura Trees. Exquisite in quality and full of moisture, people say that it can lull people into dreams as sweet as the warm spring.
Can be used to create furnishings.

Maple Wood.name: Maple Wood
Maple Wood.desc:
Timber from the Amur Maple. Excellent quality wood with a fine color and texture.
Can be used to create furnishings.

Aralia Wood.name: Aralia Wood
Aralia Wood.desc:
Wood from the Inazuman Cedar. It is soft, has straight veins, and gives off a light fragrance.
Can be used to create furnishings.

Otogi Wood.name: Otogi Wood
Otogi Wood.desc:
Wood from the Otogi Tree. It has just the right amount of moisture and oil, and as such has a great many uses.
Can be used to create furnishings.

Fragrant Cedar Wood.name: Fragrant Cedar Wood
Fragrant Cedar Wood.desc:
Wood from the Cedar tree. Also known as the "Fragrant Cedar" for the aromatic oils it contains.
Can be used to create furnishings.

Bamboo Segment.name: Bamboo Segment
Bamboo Segment.desc:
Segments of bamboo that are light and far stronger than their humble appearance might suggest. It lets off a light fragrance.
Can be used to create furnishings.

Sandbearer Wood.name: Sandbearer Wood
Sandbearer Wood.desc:
Timber from the Sandbearer Tree. Said to be an exceptionally hardy plant resistant to wind and rain with a long lifespan.
Can be used to create furnishings.

Pine Wood.name: Pine Wood
Pine Wood.desc:
Timber obtained from pines. Its color and grain are nothing to write home about, but its unpretentious nature is elegant in its own right. The wood is very sturdy as well. In able hands, its products should be able to resist moth and rot alike.
Can be used to create furnishings.

Cuihua Wood.name: Cuihua Wood
Cuihua Wood.desc:
Timber obtained from Cuihua Trees. With its lovely color and unique make, it will surely be able to take on myriad uses upon undergoing suitable workmanship.
Can be used to create furnishings.

Birch Wood.name: Birch Wood
Birch Wood.desc:
Timber obtained from birches. It is easy to work with and produces smooth cuts. Furniture made using such wood is both beautiful and durable.
Can be used to create furnishings.

Northlander Sword Billet.name: Northlander Sword Billet
Northlander Sword Billet.desc:
Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star swords. 
Philosophers believe marble has the potential to be sculpted into a beautiful statue. Likewise, these billets have the potential to become something greater.

Northlander Bow Billet.name: Northlander Bow Billet
Northlander Bow Billet.desc:
Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star bows. 
Philosophers believe marble has the potential to be sculpted into a beautiful statue. Likewise, these billets have the potential to become something greater.

Northlander Claymore Billet.name: Northlander Claymore Billet
Northlander Claymore Billet.desc:
Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star claymores. 
Philosophers believe marble has the potential to be sculpted into a beautiful statue. Likewise, these billets have the potential to become something greater.

Northlander Catalyst Billet.name: Northlander Catalyst Billet
Northlander Catalyst Billet.desc:
Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star catalysts. 
Philosophers believe marble has the potential to be sculpted into a beautiful statue. Likewise, these billets have the potential to become something greater.

Northlander Polearm Billet.name: Northlander Polearm Billet
Northlander Polearm Billet.desc:
Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star polearms. 
Philosophers believe marble has the potential to be sculpted into a beautiful statue. Likewise, these billets have the potential to become something greater.

Fruit Paste Bait.name: Fruit Paste Bait
Fruit Paste Bait.desc:
A very commonly-seen bait made from mashing, fermenting, and kneading Sunsettias and Wheat together. It atomizes very quickly upon hitting the water and exerts an incredible attraction on small fish. Due to the ease of its making, cheap price, and its excellent efficacy, it has also been jokingly called the "Fisher's Trusty Treasure."

Suitable for catching Medakas, Dawncatchers, and Crystalfish.

Redrot Bait.name: Redrot Bait
Redrot Bait.desc:
Fish bait made from mixing Dendrobium and mashed meat. The unique rank sweetness of this bait spreads very quickly in the water, attracting fierce aquatic predators. Use with caution, however! Put too much of this bait down and you might hook in nastier customers than you bargained for!

Suitable for catching Sticklebacks, Bettas, Venomspine Fish, Akai Maou, and Snowstriders.

False Worm Bait.name: False Worm Bait
False Worm Bait.desc:
This imitation worm bait is made mostly out of condensate, and will twist its body according to the underwater currents, resulting in its fatal attraction to overly-curious fish. Professionals will even add some fruit to it to increase its fragrance and make it utterly irresistable.

Suitable for catching Shirakodai and Angelfish.

Fake Fly Bait.name: Fake Fly Bait
Fake Fly Bait.desc:
Mimetic fly bait made from vibrantly-colored materials. It has no scent, and is specialized to attract large fish with sharp vision. It is often well-suited to more advanced angling techniques. The fishing associations of various regions regard the skilled use of such bait as one of the conditions for its members' advancement in rank.

Suitable for catching Koi, Pufferfish, and Rays.

Mist Flower Corolla.name: Mist Flower Corolla
Mist Flower Corolla.desc: A flower bud encased in solid ice. Even after being picked, the flower continues to emit cold.
Mist Flower Corolla.longDesc: A flower bud encased in solid ice. Even after being picked the flower continues to emit cold. A popular work of fiction tells of a fox becoming trapped in ice from a Mist Flower and being unable to extricate itself. For small creatures with limited strength, it is a very dangerous plant indeed.

Flaming Flower Stamen.name: Flaming Flower Stamen
Flaming Flower Stamen.desc: The stamen of a fiercely burning flower. Even after being extinguished, it still emits heat.
Flaming Flower Stamen.longDesc: The stamen of a fiercely burning flower. Even after being extinguished, it still emits heat. It is said that this plant slowly develops intelligence and unique behaviors as it accumulates elemental energy.
sources: Recommendation: Found at the Thousand Winds Temple

Electro Crystal.name: Electro Crystal
Electro Crystal.desc: A power-rich crystal that draws electricity from the air around it. Holding it makes your hand a little numb.
Electro Crystal.longDesc: A power-rich crystal that draws electricity from the air around it. Holding it makes your hand a little numb. With the right equipment, maybe it's possible to harness the Electro energy contained within?

Cor Lapis.name: Cor Lapis
Cor Lapis.desc: A precious crystal of condensed pure Geo element that usually grows along with other minerals. It's also commonly called "Cor Petrae."

Dandelion Seed.name: Dandelion Seed
Dandelion Seed.desc: A tiny seed that rides on the wind. Even without its feathered wings, it still holds the hope from afar within.
Dandelion Seed.longDesc: A tiny seed that rides on the wind. Even without its feathered wings, it still holds the hope from afar within. In a sense, the dandelion represents the romantic spirit of love and freedom. In the land of the wind, where dandelions are found in abundance, people use dandelions in wine making. Experts in local folklore believe that in ancient times, wine brewed from dandelions had a strong symbolic meaning.

Butterfly Wings.name: Butterfly Wings
Butterfly Wings.desc: Brightly colored wings. The powder that falls from them shimmers a little. Perhaps this is what allows them to fly?

Frog.name: Frog
Frog.desc: Common frog found in moist environments. Full of energy, they secrete a substance that will keep you full of vitality.
sources: Found near bodies of fresh water

Luminescent Spine.name: Luminescent Spine
Luminescent Spine.desc: The light-emitting part of a firefly. Used for courtship, and in medicine to help recover strength.

Lizard Tail.name: Lizard Tail
Lizard Tail.desc: A lizard tail that curled up after losing its owner. Very bitter, but has skin hardening properties.

Crystal Core.name: Crystal Core
Crystal Core.desc: The core of a crystal butterfly. It absorbs elemental energy that has escaped into the atmosphere.

Loach Pearl.name: Loach Pearl
Loach Pearl.desc:
A shiny pearl spat out by a loach that has mystical medicinal properties.
Minerals and elemental particles ingested by the loach condense into these mildly magical beads. When threatened, the loach spits them out to confuse predators and escape with its life.

Outrider's Champion Steak!.name: Outrider's Champion Steak!
Outrider's Champion Steak!.desc: Amber's specialty. One side is obviously uncooked. The other side gives off a subtle scent of something burnt. Close your eyes and have a big mouthful, just to keep Amber happy if nothing else.
Outrider's Champion Steak!.effect: Revives a character and restores 10% of Max HP, then restores an additional 150 HP.

Fruity Skewers.name: Fruity Skewers
Fruity Skewers.desc: Kaeya's specialty. A chewy skewer with a rich sweet aftertaste. Wait... Is this really the smell of fruit?
Fruity Skewers.effect: Restores 16% of Max HP and an additional 1,350 HP to the selected character.

Mysterious Bolognese.name: Mysterious Bolognese
Mysterious Bolognese.desc: Lisa's specialty. With an inexplicable aura, this bolognese is so exotic that you can never have enough. Did she actually enchant it with some kind of magic?
Mysterious Bolognese.effect: Restores 26% of Max HP to the selected character and regenerates 570 HP every 5s for 30s.

Spicy Stew.name: Spicy Stew
Spicy Stew.desc: Barbara's specialty. Carrots cut into cute little stars make this dish... Wait, AHH, where did this spiciness come from!?
Spicy Stew.effect: Decreases all party members' sprinting Stamina consumption by 25% for 1500s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Invigorating Pizza.name: Invigorating Pizza
Invigorating Pizza.desc: Jean's specialty. This pizza almost seems more art than food. Just one slice is enough to have you raring to go. Is this what keeps Jean working so hard?
Invigorating Pizza.effect: Restores 34% of Max HP to the selected character and regenerates 980 HP every 5s for 30s.

Puppy-Paw Hash Brown.name: Puppy-Paw Hash Brown
Puppy-Paw Hash Brown.desc: Razor's specialty. Carefully shaped to resemble a wolf's paw. You can really feel the effort he has put into trying human cooking.
Puppy-Paw Hash Brown.effect: Restores 40% of Max HP and an additional 2,350 HP to the selected character.

\"Once Upon a Time in Mondstadt\".name: "Once Upon a Time in Mondstadt"
\"Once Upon a Time in Mondstadt\".desc: Diluc's specialty. Feast your eyes and then your stomach upon this delicacy as the soft ribs melt in your mouth. Who knew Diluc was able to cook this well?
\"Once Upon a Time in Mondstadt\".effect: Increases all party members' CRIT Rate by 20% and CRIT DMG by 20% for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s)

Lighter-Than-Air Pancake.name: Lighter-Than-Air Pancake
Lighter-Than-Air Pancake.desc: Noelle's specialty. These thick pastries are the special afternoon snacks of the Knights of Favonius. They give people the sense that they have fallen upon a layer of fluffy clouds, and seeing Noelle's smile makes the feeling all the sweeter!
Lighter-Than-Air Pancake.effect: Revives a character and restores 15% of Max HP, then restores an additional 550 HP.

A Buoyant Breeze.name: A Buoyant Breeze
A Buoyant Breeze.desc: Venti's specialty. Other than the Cecilia flowers used for decoration, the ingredients are no different from normal. But if you taste it carefully, you can taste the flavor of "a wind that brings hope and tiny twists of fate." Perhaps... this is exactly what he wants.
A Buoyant Breeze.effect: Decreases all party members' gliding and sprinting Stamina consumption by 25% for 1800s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Fish-Flavored Toast.name: Fish-Flavored Toast
Fish-Flavored Toast.desc: Klee's specialty. By way of apology for wantonly using her bombs to scare away the fish, Jean instructed Klee to make this toast for the fishermen. It's filling and tasty. Klee will never starve again, even after a whole day of blast fishing.
Fish-Flavored Toast.effect: Increases all party members' DEF by 151 for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Teyvat Charred Egg.name: Teyvat Charred Egg
Teyvat Charred Egg.desc: Bennett's specialty. For some reason, every single fried egg is a little burnt around the edges. That said, the burnt crisp does lends a whole new flavor to the dish.
Teyvat Charred Egg.effect: Revives a character and restores 10% of Max HP, then restores an additional 150 HP.

Wanmin Restaurant's Boiled Fish.name: Wanmin Restaurant's Boiled Fish
Wanmin Restaurant's Boiled Fish.desc: Xiangling's specialty. This is the signature dish of the Wanmin Restaurant, combining Xiangling's heartfelt passion for cuisine. Anyone who tastes it will gain a pure appreciation for gourmet food amid the hearty and addictive blend of flavors.
Wanmin Restaurant's Boiled Fish.effect: Restores 34% of Max HP to the selected character and regenerates 980 HP every 5s for 30s.

All-Delicacy Parcels.name: All-Delicacy Parcels
All-Delicacy Parcels.desc: Xingqiu's specialty. This dish's almost artisan appearance makes one almost reluctant to tuck in. But once you get a taste, its fresh, light and lovely sweetness will make the dish hard to put down.... Hang on a moment. Did he throw the carrots out, by any chance?
All-Delicacy Parcels.effect: Restores 26% of Max HP to the selected character and regenerates 570 HP every 5s for 30s.

Cold Noodles with Mountain Delicacies.name: Cold Noodles with Mountain Delicacies
Cold Noodles with Mountain Delicacies.desc: Chongyun's specialty. Though these springy noodles would be irresistible in the sweltering summer, Chongyun insists on dining on them even in the chattering cold of winter. What a guy.

Qiankun Mora Meat.name: Qiankun Mora Meat
Qiankun Mora Meat.desc: Ningguang's specialty. The pastry is perfectly soft and waxy, as is the consistency of the meat, and the honey-like meat juices ooze out as you squeeze it. Wherever did the high and mighty Tianquan Lady Ningguang learn to make this dish?
Qiankun Mora Meat.effect: Revives a character and restores 10% of Max HP, then restores an additional 150 HP.

Definitely Not Bar Food!.name: Definitely Not Bar Food!
Definitely Not Bar Food!.desc: Diona's specialty. The fish skin is crisp, and the meat is sumptuous. Only someone with a sufficiently great love for fish would be able to bring out such lovely flavors. Now, if only there were something to drink to go with it... Uh-oh, she's looking this way!
Definitely Not Bar Food!.effect: Revives a character and restores 10% of Max HP, then restores an additional 150 HP.

Der Weisheit Letzter Schluss (Life).name: Der Weisheit Letzter Schluss (Life)
Der Weisheit Letzter Schluss (Life).desc: Mona's specialty. A great work from a great astrologer. Its greatest aspect lies with its cost-effectiveness in filling one's stomach.
Der Weisheit Letzter Schluss (Life).effect: Increases all party members' CRIT Rate by 16% for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Die Heilige Sinfonie.name: Die Heilige Sinfonie
Die Heilige Sinfonie.desc: Fischl's specialty. The exquisite presentation doth seem to communicate some incomprehensible enigma. When partaking, if one were to gaze upon Fischl, one might see her expectant gaze peek through the gaps of her fingers, which she is using to cover half her face... Is this also part of the mystery?
Die Heilige Sinfonie.effect: Increases all party members' Physical DMG by 55% for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

No Tomorrow.name: No Tomorrow
No Tomorrow.desc: Qiqi's specialty. The neat rows of ingredients seem at once exotic and delicious, and Baizhu says that Qiqi has spent a long time creating this dish. Still, once one considers that Qiqi has no sense of taste, just putting chopsticks to the food is going to take some courage.
No Tomorrow.effect: Increases all party members' CRIT Rate by 20% and CRIT DMG by 20% for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s)

Flash-Fried Filet.name: Flash-Fried Filet
Flash-Fried Filet.desc: Beidou's specialty. They say that Beidou once learned some tricks from Xiangling, making some refinements and adding more flavor to this dish. If you can clean it out in one go, perhaps you might impress her.
Flash-Fried Filet.effect: Revives a character and restores 10% of Max HP, then restores an additional 150 HP.

Survival Grilled Fish.name: Survival Grilled Fish
Survival Grilled Fish.desc: Keqing's specialty. This dish was not grilled. Instead, it was fried from within through the delicate application of Electro. A gentle bite reveals fragrant fish under the lightly charred skin, its taste perfectly balanced. So, is this how she survives in the wild? You really can't judge a book by its cover.
Survival Grilled Fish.effect: Restores 16% of Max HP and an additional 1,350 HP to the selected character.

Nutritious Meal (V.593).name: Nutritious Meal (V.593)
Nutritious Meal (V.593).desc: Sucrose's specialty. It looks like some strange alchemical product at first, but Sucrose insists that it is a healthy and nutritious meal, the result of many experiments and painstaking improvements. Its healthy green color comes from a mix of cream and natural vegetable juices... Wait, vegetable juices?
Nutritious Meal (V.593).effect: Revives the selected character and restores 20% of Max HP, then restores an additional 1500 HP.

Slow-Cooked Bamboo Shoot Soup.name: Slow-Cooked Bamboo Shoot Soup
Slow-Cooked Bamboo Shoot Soup.desc: Zhongli's specialty. The ham is a butt end selected according to Yuehai Pavilion's gourmet standards. The fresh meat is pork belly, freshly hunted in Springvale, while the bamboo shoots are the densest you'll find in Qingce Village. It is then heated, slowly, gently, and with the utmost care and technique... Such a "particular" taste may only be shared with those who know how to appreciate it.
Slow-Cooked Bamboo Shoot Soup.effect: Restores 34% of Max HP to the selected character and regenerates 980 HP every 5s for 30s.

Rockin' Riffin' Chicken!.name: Rockin' Riffin' Chicken!
Rockin' Riffin' Chicken!.desc: Xinyan's specialty. Its demonic appearance hides an absolutely demonic spiciness. Eat it, tear up, eat some more, and don't stop till you drop! Surely only a demon could have invented such a dish!
Rockin' Riffin' Chicken!.effect: Increases all party members' CRIT Rate by 16% for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

A Prize Catch.name: A Prize Catch
A Prize Catch.desc: Tartaglia's specialty. It looks like a trapped beast floundering in an ocean of blood, its death throes an inaudible scream... But Tartaglia smiles and explains that this is something he fished out of the sea, with some products from his homeland on the side.
A Prize Catch.effect: Increases all party members' DEF by 282 for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Prosperous Peace.name: Prosperous Peace
Prosperous Peace.desc: Ganyu's specialty. The image of a resting qilin is by itself enough to calm a person down. Ganyu has put her well-wishes for all that is lovely in this world into this dish â€” and she's saved some of her favorite Qingxin Flowers just for you, too.
Prosperous Peace.effect: Restores 40% of Max HP and an additional 2,350 HP to the selected character.

Woodland Dream.name: Woodland Dream
Woodland Dream.desc: Albedo's specialty. The fruits and vegetables are laid out like grass, and they stand tall like trees. In this miniature world-in-a-plate, you circle the mottled city wall, follow brown alleys, and enter the light orange castle. A sweet, tender taste then bursts forth like a blooming flower. You open your eyes. There is a smile in the white-haired prince's eyes.
Woodland Dream.effect: Increases all party members' Shield Strength by 35% for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

\"Sweet Dream\".name: "Sweet Dream"
\"Sweet Dream\".desc: Xiao's specialty. His dream is very simple, and it is merely a lovely dream.
\"Sweet Dream\".effect: Increases all party members' ATK by 114 for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Ghostly March.name: Ghostly March
Ghostly March.desc: Hu Tao's specialty. The round-faced ghouls seem quite cute, squeezed into a pile as they are. But if you were to fall to temptation and try but one of them, you may yet come to regret it for a long while... After all, this plate is full of top-quality, taste-bud-blastingâ€” Actually, what on earth is this stuff, anyway?
Ghostly March.effect: Revives a character and restores 15% of Max HP, then restores an additional 550 HP.

Dinner of Judgment.name: Dinner of Judgment
Dinner of Judgment.desc: Rosaria's specialty. The seemingly dark thorns make it hard to know how to begin tucking in. After some effort, you manage to clear the ornamentation away... and to your surprise, the first taste of the tender chicken unveils a shockingly lovely taste. As Rosaria studies your reaction, she seems pleased.
Dinner of Judgment.effect: Restores 30% of Max HP and an additional 1,750 HP to the selected character.

\"My Way\".name: "My Way"
\"My Way\".desc: Yanfei's specialty is Crab Roe Tofu done to an incredible degree of regularity. Its dimensions and flavor are all faithfully rendered according to the "Crab Roe Tofu Laws" in the recipe, with not a single letter omitted.
\"My Way\".effect: Revives a character and restores 15% of Max HP, then restores an additional 550 HP.

Stormcrest Pie.name: Stormcrest Pie
Stormcrest Pie.desc: Eula's specialty. It's hard to say if the unorthodox, non-full-moon shape is meant to flout tradition or express her "tooth for a tooth" ethos. A rich, savory, and smoky flavor emanates from beneath the golden outer crust, unlikely to be reproducible by anybody else in Mondstadt. Best not to tell her all this, though, lest she add it to her list of personal vendettas.
Stormcrest Pie.effect: Increases all party members' Shield Strength by 40% and DEF by 282 for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

\"Snow on the Hearth\".name: "Snow on the Hearth"
\"Snow on the Hearth\".desc: Kamisato Ayaka's specialty. This is almost like a small, lovely, and intricate artwork, with its pale red outer coat covering the feelings that the young maiden began to harbor from that moment on. If one had the honor of enjoy such a treat while having tea with a princess as graceful and noble as a white heron, one would surely yearn to have that moment stretch into eternity.
\"Snow on the Hearth\".effect: Revives the selected character and restores 20% of Max HP, then restores an additional 1500 HP.

All-Weather Beauty.name: All-Weather Beauty
All-Weather Beauty.desc: Kaedehara Kazuha's specialty. Made from fish that have been dried on the ship. Kazuha claims that they were completely ordinary fish. But this flavor... this must surely be the definition of free, all-embracing nature, no?
All-Weather Beauty.effect: Restores 16% of Max HP and an additional 1,350 HP to the selected character.

Summer Festival Fish.name: Summer Festival Fish
Summer Festival Fish.desc: Yoimiya's specialty. Watching the fireworks, your hands full of the snacks Yoimiya's given you, her carefree, child-like laughter in your ear as the pyrotechnics burst overhead... Amid this unique symphony of sounds, the plump goldfish in your hand almost looks like it might start swimming at any moment...
Summer Festival Fish.effect: Restores 40% of Max HP and an additional 2,350 HP to the selected character.

Dizziness-Be-Gone no Jutsu Version 2.0.name: Dizziness-Be-Gone no Jutsu Version 2.0
Dizziness-Be-Gone no Jutsu Version 2.0.desc: Sayu's specialty. The Onigiri has been kneaded by Sayu into a cutesy shape â€” but remember, it's a mujina, not a tanuki, got it? And now that you mention it, this must be how Sayu can sleep for a whole day after eating, right?
Dizziness-Be-Gone no Jutsu Version 2.0.effect: Restores 26% of Max HP to the selected character and regenerates 570 HP every 5s for 30s.

Satiety Gel.name: Satiety Gel
Satiety Gel.desc: Aloy's specialty. The cross-section looks perfect, its shape is regular, and it gives off a cool air. At first, Aloy seemed a bit apprehensive as to whether you'd enjoy this rather unique dessert, but she was relieved when you wolfed it all down in one go...
Satiety Gel.effect: Restores 16% of Max HP and an additional 1,350 HP to the selected character.

A Stunning Stratagem.name: A Stunning Stratagem
A Stunning Stratagem.desc: Sangonomiya Kokomi's specialty. The egg is wrapped up almost like a package, and the fish tail at the end is both small and very cute. It really makes you wonder what's inside the package, but at the same time, you can't bear to eat such a beautiful-looking thing... You glance at the crystal-clear smile in Kokomi's eyes. Ah, darn it, you've fallen for her trick, haven't you?
A Stunning Stratagem.effect: Restores 16% of Max HP and an additional 1,350 HP to the selected character.

Faith Eternal.name: Faith Eternal
Faith Eternal.desc: Kujou Sara's specialty. Forget calling it a dish, this is really more like a snack. The sweet, fluffy flavor really doesn't seem to suit Sara's own preferences. Wait a moment. That symbol on the snack â€” does this have to do with a certain other person's tastes instead?
Faith Eternal.effect: Revives a character and restores 10% of Max HP, then restores an additional 150 HP.

\"Warmth\".name: "Warmth"
\"Warmth\".desc: Thoma's specialty. The intricate appearance of this dish belies the simple ingredients used. But take a sip, and Thoma's sunshine smile comes straight to mind. Perhaps this is his special ability: warming the hearts of others using the simplest of ingredients.
\"Warmth\".effect: Restores 14% of Max HP to the selected character and regenerates 350 HP every 5s for 30s.

Way of the Strong.name: Way of the Strong
Way of the Strong.desc: Arataki Itto's specialty. He insists that this is a "heretofore unmatched dish" hand-made by "Arataki 'Number One Gourmet' Itto." Whether standing, sitting, or lying down, this'll fill your tummy in one shot and send you well on your way to becoming the second-mightiest being in the world. What a swell guy.
Way of the Strong.effect: Revives a character and restores 15% of Max HP, then restores an additional 550 HP.

Victorious Legend.name: Victorious Legend
Victorious Legend.desc: Gorou's specialty. The side dishes have been piled high to form a sight as moving as Gorou's own motivations. As you finish the noodles and soup all in one go and pat your stomach in satisfaction, you look up and see Gorou... smiling radiantly as his tail wags from side to side (the latter probably unbeknownst to him!)
Victorious Legend.effect: Restores 40% of Max HP and an additional 2,350 HP to the selected character.

Heartstring Noodles.name: Heartstring Noodles
Heartstring Noodles.desc: Shenhe's specialty. Perhaps this comes from her desire to recreate a flavor that lives only in her memories, but Shenhe has poured much time and effort into both making and plating this dish. The smooth noodles and delectable soup make a great impression indeed, but the most indelible aspects are the dedication and heart put into this dish...
Heartstring Noodles.effect: Increases all party members' ATK by 274 for 300s. In Co-op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Cloud-Shrouded Jade.name: Cloud-Shrouded Jade
Cloud-Shrouded Jade.desc: Yun Jin's specialty. This sweet and sticky snack will somehow not affect your throat in any negative way, which is why it's Yun Jin's favorite. The aftertaste is most elegant, not something one would get sick of quickly. Come to think of it... This is quite a decent bit more than she would usually make for herself â€” but who are you to question her kindness?

specialty.recipe: Lotus Seed and Bird Egg Soup

Cloud-Shrouded Jade.effect: Decreases all party members' sprinting Stamina consumption by 25% for 1500s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Fukuuchi Udon.effect: Revives a character and restores 15% of Max HP, then restores an additional 550 HP.

Fisherman's Toast.name: Fisherman's Toast

Crab, Ham & Veggie Bake.name: Crab, Ham & Veggie Bake
Crab, Ham & Veggie Bake.desc: A luxurious bake. The scent is so rich and heavenly. You'll only be done once you've licked the plate clean.

Jade Parcels.name: Jade Parcels
Jade Parcels.desc: An exquisite-looking dish. The sweetness of the ham and the crisp lotus seeds are a match made in heaven. The aromatic broth pours down like the dawning light, caressing your tongue with an unworldly delicious taste.

Zhongyuan Chop Suey.name: Zhongyuan Chop Suey
Zhongyuan Chop Suey.desc: A seasoned and cooked meat dish. The authentic "Liyue taste" of this aromatic dish makes it a comfort food for golden-agers that may bring a tear to their eyes.
Zhongyuan Chop Suey.longDesc: A seasoned and cooked meat dish. Grilled Tiger Fish.longDesc:
A fish kebab grilled over an open flame. The fish is a fresh catch straight from the harbor, lightly seasoned and swiftly grilled. Its aroma attracts the street cats. Indeed, freshness is the secret of flavor.
Traditionally, the dish now known as Tiger Fish referred exclusively to grilled Ticker Fish. Over time, however, the dish's name turned into Tiger Fish, and came to refer to grilled fish in general. In fact, the true Ticker Fish underwent a sharp decline in population along with many other sea creatures years ago, and is now on the verge of extinction.

Wait, why don't we just dip our bread in that?

effect.Suspicious Braised Meat: Increases all party members' Physical DMG by 20% for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).
effect.Braised Meat: Increases all party members' Physical DMG by 30% for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).
effect.Delicious Braised Meat: Increases all party members' Physical DMG by 40% for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Oncidium Tofu.name: Oncidium Tofu
Oncidium Tofu.desc: A dish that is a test of one's knifework. The tofu, thread-thin as the autumn leaves, floats amidst the bowl, like mist in a forest, and the shredded bamboo shoots give the image a sweet, lustrous sheen, while the broth combines the essence of fowl and ham, giving off an unbelievable aroma. A single taste is enough to cause the customer to lose themselves in this fog of flavor.

Chili-Mince Cornbread Buns.name: Chili-Mince Cornbread Buns
Chili-Mince Cornbread Buns.desc: A traditional snack from Liyue. The intense charred aroma of the wok sits on the condiments, which are shoveled into the fluffy buns, filling the air with a fragrance that itself worth rave reviews. Just as the laboring hands of Liyue's people created this famous, prosperous harbor, these ordinary ingredients can be "developed" by one's labor into something surprising in its deliciousness. No wonder such a dish could even awaken a sleeping god...

effect.Suspicious Chili-Mince Cornbread Buns: Increases all party members' Shield Strength by 25% and DEF by 165 for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).
effect.Chili-Mince Cornbread Buns: Increases all party members' Shield Strength by 30% and DEF by 200 for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).
effect.Delicious Chili-Mince Cornbread Buns: Increases all party members' Shield Strength by 35% and DEF by 235 for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Golden Fried Chicken.name: Golden Fried Chicken
Golden Fried Chicken.desc: Fowl that has been seasoned and then fried. The golden outer skin has all but sealed the abundant juices into the meat, leading to absolute enjoyment with each bite. The taste at your fingertips will linger in memory far longer than the instant it takes to reduce the meal to nothing but slim bones.

effect.Suspicious Golden Fried Chicken: Increases all party members' ATK by 224 and CRIT Rate by 6% for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).
effect.Golden Fried Chicken: Increases all party members' ATK by 272 and CRIT Rate by 8% for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).
effect.Delicious Golden Fried Chicken: Increases all party members' ATK by 320 and CRIT Rate by 10% for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Golden Chicken Burger.name: Golden Chicken Burger
Golden Chicken Burger.desc: A burger in which the fowl meat is the main star. The fowl fillet has been wrapped in gold and is so tender that you could almost squeeze the meat juices out. The dense flavor of the sauce and refreshing mouthfeel of the vegetables makes you feel like you're walking on clouds as you lose yourself in this feast lying in your palm.

effect.Suspicious Golden Chicken Burger: Restores 30% of Max HP and an additional 600 HP to the selected character.
effect.Golden Chicken Burger: Restores 32% of Max HP and an additional 1,250 HP to the selected character.
effect.Delicious Golden Chicken Burger: Restores 34% of Max HP and an additional 1,900 HP to the selected character.

Fragrant Mashed Potatoes.name: Fragrant Mashed Potatoes
Fragrant Mashed Potatoes.desc: Seasoned mashed potatoes. As you take a bite of this fine potato mash, an intense flavor develops on your tongue that is mixed with its natural freshness and the taste of dairy. Such a graceful flavor can hardly be thought to have emerged from an ingredient as plebeian as potatoes.

effect.Suspicious Fragrant Mashed Potatoes: Increases all party members' ATK by 160 for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).
effect.Fragrant Mashed Potatoes: Increases all party members' ATK by 194 for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).
effect.Delicious Fragrant Mashed Potatoes: Increases all party members' ATK by 228 for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Holy Water.name: Holy Water
Holy Water.desc: A bottle of clear, colorless, and contaminant-free liquid. Indistinguishable from ordinary spring water. May or may not be worth putting all of one's hopes into.
Holy Water.longDesc: A bottle of clear, colorless, and contaminant-free liquid. Indistinguishable from ordinary spring water. May or may not be worth putting all of one's hopes into. A local legend claims that a certain supernatural presence exists in the spring at the far side of Springvale which borders the mountains. If this is the case, maybe there really is something special in this bottle of water?

Pop's Teas.name: Pop's Teas
Pop's Teas.desc: Tea from Liyue. After a grueling trek around the vast region of Liyue, there's nothing more rejuvenating than a big swig of tea from Pop's Teas.
Pop's Teas.effect: Restores 14% of Max HP to the selected character and regenerates 350 HP every 5s for 30s.

Wolfhook Juice.name: Wolfhook Juice
Wolfhook Juice.desc: A freshly squeezed, fashionable, and fruity non-alcoholic beverage. Iced Wolfhook juice mixed with a pinch of other ingredients, forming a dreamy shade of violet.
Wolfhook Juice.effect: Increases all party members' ATK by 114 for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Berry & Mint Burst.name: Berry & Mint Burst
Berry & Mint Burst.desc: A freshly squeezed, fashionable, and fruity non-alcoholic beverage. A refreshing burst of Mint with Berries to sweeten the deal, it has an exquisite aroma.
Berry & Mint Burst.effect: Increases all party members' CRIT Rate by 16% for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Special Mushroom Pizza.name: Special Mushroom Pizza
Special Mushroom Pizza.desc: A pancake with ample toppings. The many rare ingredients do a strange dance around one's tongue â€” albeit in a good way.
Special Mushroom Pizza.effect: Restores 28% of Max HP to the selected character and regenerates 620 HP every 5s for 30s.

Dango Milk.name: Dango Milk
Dango Milk.desc:
A creative snack made by adding sticky dango to milk. It is sweet and has a dense mouthfeel. All the customers who have tried it love it.
Still, it is dango that's been added in â€” drink too much and you might lose your appetite.
Dango Milk.effect: Restores 26% of Max HP to the selected character and regenerates 570 HP every 5s for 30s.

Wheat.name: Wheat
Wheat.desc: Golden, sun-kissed tassels. Needs to be ground down to flour for further use.

Cabbage.name: Cabbage
Cabbage.desc: A layered, leafy vegetable. Said to have originally been an ornamental plant, it certainly looks great in the pot.

Salt.name: Salt
Salt.desc: A savory seasoning. A precise but adequate amount will elevate the quality of the cuisine.
Salt.longDesc: A savory seasoning. A precise but adequate amount will elevate the quality of the cuisine. It is said that someone once lived who implored his descendants to "Be unto this world as salt is unto rocks."

Onion.name: Onion
Onion.desc: A spherical vegetable. As vengeance for cutting it, it will make you cry, no matter how brave you are.

Pepper.name: Pepper
Pepper.desc: Peppery. Cuts through oily flavors and excites the taste buds. Goes best on meat.

Milk.name: Milk
Milk.desc: Sweet and fragrant cow's milk. Don't waste a single drop, not even that one rolling down your chin.

Tomato.name: Tomato
Tomato.desc: A bright red ingredient that gives a tangy kick. Yes, the "fruit or vegetable" debate is still going...

Potato.name: Potato
Potato.desc: A chunky vegetable. A gift from the earth that you never tire of with its multitude of cooking methods.

Tofu.name: Tofu
Tofu.desc: Freshly made bean product that has a silky-smooth tender texture.
sources: Sold at general goods shops in Liyue
Sold at general goods shops in Inazuma

Almond.name: Almond
Almond.desc: A seed with a peculiar fragrance that gives food a refreshing taste.
sources: Sold at general goods shops in Liyue

Rice.name: Rice
Rice.desc: A grain crop commonly found in Teyvat. People of all walks of life enjoy its distinct grainy texture. As the saying goes, "The same kind of rice can feed one hundred kinds of people."
sources: Sold at general goods shops in Liyue
Sold at general goods shops in Inazuma

Shrimp Meat.name: Shrimp Meat
Shrimp Meat.desc: A whole piece of deep sea shrimp meat, full of nutrients and bursting with delicious flavor.
sources: Sold at general goods shops in Liyue
Sold at general goods shops in Inazuma

Flour.name: Flour
Flour.desc: A powder ground from wheat. No matter what it goes into, it brings a sense of satisfaction to the diner.

Cream.name: Cream
Cream.desc: A dairy product made from milk. An essential ingredient in making pastries.

Smoked Fowl.name: Smoked Fowl
Smoked Fowl.desc: Fowl that has been smoked. The firmness of the meat gives new texture to dishes.

Butter.name: Butter
Butter.desc: An extract from milk. With the appropriate application, it can bring rich aromas to even the most basic ingredients.

Ham.name: Ham
Ham.desc: Smoked leg meat. Even the thinnest slice is packed full of flavor.

Sugar.name: Sugar
Sugar.desc: A seasoning derived from Sweet Flowers. Has the power to give both energy and happiness.

Jam.name: Jam
Jam.desc: A gelatinous substance made from fruit and sugar. Even a little bit can easily wake up tired taste buds.

Cheese.name: Cheese
Cheese.desc: Made from fermented milk. High in energy, it's used in a wide range of dishes.

Bacon.name: Bacon
Bacon.desc: Smoked strips of pork. Crispy with a bit of fat, but not too greasy. Mmmmm... bacon.

Sausage.name: Sausage
Sausage.desc: Finely minced meat wrapped in a skin. A staple of every meat lover's daily diet.

Crab Roe.name: Crab Roe
Crab Roe.desc: A delicacy specific to female crabs. A rare and prized ingredient that isn't quite to everyone's taste.

Raw Meat.name: Raw Meat
Raw Meat.desc: A fresh chunk of meat. Handled properly, it can be used to make delicious food.
Raw Meat.longDesc:
A fresh chunk of meat. Handled properly, it can be used to make delicious food.
All kinds of creatures roam the vast lands of Teyvat, some of which have become sources of nutrition for humans. It is said that in the distant past, there existed a species of animal so large that it could feed an entire city for a year.

Fowl.name: Fowl
Fowl.desc: A fresh chunk of fowl. Handled properly, it can make a hearty meal.
Fowl.longDesc:
A fresh chunk of fowl. Handled properly, it can make a hearty meal.
Unlike the land-dwelling creatures of the world, birds belong to the skies, and spend the majority of the time in flight. Birds, therefore, clock up a high amount of physical activity over their lives, which gives their meat a wholly different texture from that of land animals.

Fish.name: Fish
Fish.desc: A fresh fillet of fish. Handled properly, it can make a rich dish.
Fish.longDesc: A fresh fillet of fish. Handled properly, it can make a rich dish. Fish are the life and soul of the rivers, lakes, and seas.

Crab.name: Crab
Crab.desc: A shelled creature that lives near the ocean. Its flaky, delicious meat can easily be made into tasty dishes.
sources: Found near lakes, river banks, and beaches

Chilled Meat.name: Chilled Meat
Chilled Meat.desc:
Rare, fresh meat.
This species of boar is recorded to have gone extinct several hundred years ago and has been preserved by the extreme temperatures on Dragonspine. For the gourmets of Teyvat, this is an ingredient of unspeakable sacrosanctness.

Unagi Meat.name: Unagi Meat
Unagi Meat.desc: The fresh meat of an Unagi. If handled properly, it can be used to make fresh, lovely food.

Heatshield Potion.name: Heatshield Potion
Heatshield Potion.desc:
A miraculous potion that boosts Pyro RES and makes one able to withstand high heat.
It works not by cooling the body, but by helping the body acclimate to high temperatures.
Heatshield Potion.effect: Increases all party members' Pyro RES by 25% for 300s.

Desiccant Potion.name: Desiccant Potion
Desiccant Potion.desc:
A kind of potion that boosts Hydro RES and makes one able to withstand highly humid environments.
It is said to act like a desiccant and be highly effective at keeping items dry. It can also be ingested for the same effect.
Desiccant Potion.effect: Increases all party members' Hydro RES by 25% for 300s.

Frostshield Potion.name: Frostshield Potion
Frostshield Potion.desc:
A miraculous potion that boosts Cryo RES and makes one able to withstand extreme cold.
Induces a chilling sensation when drank, but once this sensation spreads throughout the body, the feeling of being cold disappears.
Frostshield Potion.effect: Increases all party members' Cryo RES by 25% for 300s.

Windbarrier Potion.name: Windbarrier Potion
Windbarrier Potion.desc:
A mysterious potion that boosts Anemo RES and makes one able to withstand strong winds.
It works wonders for adventurers out in the world and is even said to keep the cold away.
Windbarrier Potion.effect: Increases all party members' Anemo RES by 25% for 300s.

Insulation Potion.name: Insulation Potion
Insulation Potion.desc:
A potion that boosts Electro RES and keeps one from getting electro-shocked.
Induces a tingling sensation when drank. It is said to work by filling the body with inversely charged electrical energy, which counteracts the effect of Electro damage.
Insulation Potion.effect: Increases all party members' Electro RES by 25% for 300s.

Dustproof Potion.name: Dustproof Potion
Dustproof Potion.desc:
A potion that boosts Geo RES and keeps one from getting bothered by sand and dust.
It has a strange taste not unlike that of magnets. It keeps a traveler clean from all the sand and dust out there.
Dustproof Potion.effect: Increases all party members' Geo RES by 25% for 300s.

Flaming Essential Oil.name: Flaming Essential Oil
Flaming Essential Oil.desc:
Grants greater affinity for Pyro, boosting Pyro DMG.
It is made of materials that gestate Pyro, which serves to draw in Pyro energy more effectively. It also makes the user more fired-up and passionate.
Flaming Essential Oil.effect: Increases all party members' Pyro DMG by 25% for 300s.

Streaming Essential Oil.name: Streaming Essential Oil
Streaming Essential Oil.desc:
Grants greater affinity for Hydro, boosting Hydro DMG.
It's a slippery medicine for external use, able to better channel Hydro energy. It has a subtle fragrance.
Streaming Essential Oil.effect: Increases all party members' Hydro DMG by 25% for 300s.

Frosting Essential Oil.name: Frosting Essential Oil
Frosting Essential Oil.desc:
Grants greater affinity for Cryo, boosting Cryo DMG.
It has a chilling sensation when applied, and helps one to better channel Cryo energy. It also helps to keep you cool-headed and calm.
Frosting Essential Oil.effect: Increases all party members' Cryo DMG by 25% for 300s.

Gushing Essential Oil.name: Gushing Essential Oil
Gushing Essential Oil.desc:
Grants greater affinity for Anemo, boosting Anemo DMG.
It has a fragrant smell. It is said that using it during your travels will make you walk as if you're riding on the wind.
Gushing Essential Oil.effect: Increases all party members' Anemo DMG by 25% for 300s.

Shocking Essential Oil.name: Shocking Essential Oil
Shocking Essential Oil.desc:
Grants greater affinity for Electro, boosting Electro DMG.
It induces a tingling sensation on the skin and renders the user better able to better channel Electro energy â€” but comes with a risk of causing an electrical fire that would definitely ruin your perfect hair.
Shocking Essential Oil.effect: Increases all party members' Electro DMG by 25% for 300s.

Unmoving Essential Oil.name: Unmoving Essential Oil
Unmoving Essential Oil.desc:
Grants greater affinity for Geo, boosting Geo DMG.
You can feel the fine Geo pellets within when applied. It's said to help with physical injuries.
Unmoving Essential Oil.effect: Increases all party members' Geo DMG by 25% for 300s.

Dvalin's Plume.name: Dvalin's Plume
Dvalin's Plume.desc:
A feather from the tail of the Dragon of the East.
As a dragon's feather it has experienced more than a thousand years' worth of winds. One senses within it a yearning for freedom so strong that it could whip up a light breeze to rescue it from its current confines. Its former owner's recognition of you is what makes it content to stay in your hands.

Dvalin's Claw.name: Dvalin's Claw
Dvalin's Claw.desc:
A claw from the Dragon of the East.
It once contained the shadow dragon Durin's vile poison, having torn through the latter's flesh in battle. Thanks to your purification and healing, it is no longer toxic.

Dvalin's Sigh.name: Dvalin's Sigh
Dvalin's Sigh.desc:
A bit of power taken from the whirlwinds evoked by the Dragon of the East.
Beautiful and transparent, both trade winds and tornadoes will work in his name. The winds move as his companion, his voice, and his freedom.
His enemies are the thousands who stand against the wind.

Tail of Boreas.name: Tail of Boreas
Tail of Boreas.desc:
A handful of tail scales from the Great Wolf King of the North.
Even without his physical body and beyond death, Boreas still possesses extraordinary powers. He took a form comprised of ice and wind to embrace a new challenge, but even such a form could not house all of his power. The ice scales that fell during the battle still retain some of their spiritual energy.
sources: Lv. 70+ Wolf of the North Challenge Reward

Ring of Boreas.name: Ring of Boreas
Ring of Boreas.desc:
A bit of crystallized ice from the Great Wolf King of the North.
This land was once a realm of freezing-cold blizzards and ice storms filled with razor-sharp ice shards, all at the command of Boreas. Though his power may have diminished, he could still freeze the land in an instant.
sources: Lv. 70+ Wolf of the North Challenge Reward

Spirit Locket of Boreas.name: Spirit Locket of Boreas
Spirit Locket of Boreas.desc:
A bit of the Great Wolf King of the North's power drawn from its soul.
This land was once a realm of freezing-cold blizzards and ice storms filled with razor-sharp ice shards, all at the command of Boreas. In his final moments, he finally realized the chilling north wind could only extinguish life, not nurture it. Therefore, Boreas let his powers freely flow into the land to protect it and its inhabitants.
sources: Lv. 70+ Wolf of the North Challenge Reward

Tusk of Monoceros Caeli.name: Tusk of Monoceros Caeli
Tusk of Monoceros Caeli.desc:
The horn of a whale that you obtained from defeating Childe, who had unleashed the might of his Delusion.
It is said that the shape of one's constellation determines one's character. The image of a whale cruising across the celestial heights represents a solipsism that seeks to crush and devour all in its path.
Embracing this aspect of himself, Childe gleefully summoned one such beast before throwing himself into battle against you.

Shard of a Foul Legacy.name: Shard of a Foul Legacy
Shard of a Foul Legacy.desc:
The shard of a weapon that you obtained from defeating Childe, who had unleashed the might of his Delusion.
It is stained with a profound color that is not of this world, no doubt due to the land of endless darkness that the young boy saw with his own two eyes.
Perhaps it has nothing to do with the power of a Delusion, but as they say, the weapon reflects its user...

Shadow of the Warrior.name: Shadow of the Warrior
Shadow of the Warrior.desc:
A fragment of power that you obtained from defeating Childe, who had unleashed the might of his Delusion.
It is the product of a will to fight that has been honed over countless slaughters.
If humans do indeed have destinies, then his must surely have been twisted by such deeds. Why else, then, would he always be at the heart of every conflict?

Dragon Lord's Crown.name: Dragon Lord's Crown
Dragon Lord's Crown.desc:
Horns created from hardened jade crystallized over a thousand years are the natural crown of the dragon king.
Infused with spirit and carved from bedrock, it was born from the mountain's heart to show the strength of the earth to the land amidst monoliths, and its long golden horns are the mark of its ancient strife with an ancient lord.
For a time, this horn was shattered and lost its luster, but now it gleams cold and gold as it sits in your palm.

Bloodjade Branch.name: Bloodjade Branch
Bloodjade Branch.desc:
Nurtured by the might of the dragon king, these bone branches glitter with strange, unique colors.
Hatred coursed through the natural streams and kissed the cold moonlight, and from them were these crystalline branches born and grown...
Even though they were severed in battle, these branches steeped in dragon blood rustle as if eternally ill-at-ease.

Gilded Scale.name: Gilded Scale
Gilded Scale.desc:
Scaled armor that grows naturally over mystical stone, tough and silent, and filled with the strength of the dragon king.
Across the years as countless generations returned to the mulch of the earth, gold and obsidian embedded themselves into flesh and blood forged from bedrock before spreading and turning into scales.
Searing agony, wordless cries... perhaps they will all vanish when the grudges that spawned them, too, finally come to an end.

Molten Moment.name: Molten Moment
Molten Moment.desc:
A certain deformed fragment containing great might. You obtained this from defeating Signora, who unleashed her original power.
"I had a long, long dream.
"I dreamed that you and I met again in the pure white world that we created.
"But I woke up at last, having long been consumed by the raging flames, while you had long returned to the earth along with that poisoned blood.
"But none of it matters anymore. I must continue forging ahead. I must incinerate everything behind me. I must believe in that pure, spotless, everlasting realm that he spoke of â€” that I saw in the 'delusion' he let me see, at the end of the horizon of Her Majesty's dreams."

Hellfire Butterfly.name: Hellfire Butterfly
Hellfire Butterfly.desc:
A warped shard that houses great might. You obtained this from defeating Signora, who unleashed her original power.
The seal of ice was broken under duress, and as her former will surged forth from its pale white prison and she remembered her old name once more, the undying butterfly danced amidst burning flesh and blood. And she remembered her past, wandering the land, spreading the flame, burning away all evil â€” and she recalled the face of the person she could never meet again.

Ashen Heart.name: Ashen Heart
Ashen Heart.desc:
A deformed fragment that contains powerful emotions. You obtained this from defeating Signora, who unleashed her original power.
Even tears cannot extinguish the flames. Molten-hot agony and rage rush through her veins, oozing from her tear ducts.
The First Fatuus found her just before her heart could be destroyed by the eternal blaze. He understood that only deeper hate and obsession could quench the fire that devoured her and make her his ally...

Mudra of the Malefic General.name: Mudra of the Malefic General
Mudra of the Malefic General.desc:
A puppet joint obtained from the Plane of Euthymia. The gesture here symbolizes the concept that "one sees and one does."
Even now that "she" has become a calamitous deity, she can still utilize such transcendent gestures, her sword flashing forth as swiftly as her eyes may see.
And yet, as the countless disasters ground on for far too long, the fierce general's shell had to embrace a new spring.
sources: Lv. 70+ Guardian of Eternity Challenge Reward

Tears of the Calamitous God.name: Tears of the Calamitous God
Tears of the Calamitous God.desc:
A puppet joint obtained from the Plane of Euthymia. The gesture here is in the shape of the baleful Eye of Stormy Judgment.
Since they are able to bring down curse and catastrophe alike with a mere gaze, it might seem natural to blame life's misfortunes on calamitous deities. However, if you think about it a little harder, if your will is strong enough, and if your convictions are firm enough...
The catastrophes go on for too long. Even a baleful gaze must wash itself with tears.
sources: Lv. 70+ Guardian of Eternity Challenge Reward

The Meaning of Aeons.name: The Meaning of Aeons
The Meaning of Aeons.desc:
A small piece of headgear obtained once the dust settled in the Plane of Euthymia.
One thought may end all calamity, and there will always be thoughts that may transcend time.
Amid all this, one wonders if Makoto's true meaning was successfully communicated or not.
sources: Lv. 70+ Guardian of Eternity Challenge Reward

Hurricane Seed.name: Hurricane Seed
Hurricane Seed.desc:
The imploded form of an Anemo Hypostasis upon its defeat.
Contains the essence of Anemo energy.
It is said that the power to create hurricanes resides within its seemingly fragile body. This butterfly of pure Anemo energy must surely be waiting for the day when it can conjure up storms once again.

Lightning Prism.name: Lightning Prism
Lightning Prism.desc:
An Electro Hypostasis channels nearby elemental energy to repair damaged elemental entities. Contains the essence of Electro energy.
An ordinary prism separates white light into its component colors; a Lightning Prism, however, channels flowing energies and weaves them into lightning. It will continue to do so even after the Electro Hypostasis has been defeated.

Basalt Pillar.name: Basalt Pillar
Basalt Pillar.desc:
A pillar formed by the shell of a Geo Hypostasis, composed of high-density Geo energy.
It is a testament to Geo's status as the heaviest of the elements. Maybe the reason a Geo Hypostasis creates this pillar out of its shell and raises itself is just to get closer to the sky, not to combat enemies.

Hoarfrost Core.name: Hoarfrost Core
Hoarfrost Core.desc:
The exposed core of a defeated Cryo Regisvine. Pure Cryo energy is contained within it.
Energy and thoughts that swell deep within the earth will eventually erupt on the surface. Even the deathly silent frost will attach to living things on the ground, turning even ordinary vegetation like vines into huge, vicious predators.

Everflame Seed.name: Everflame Seed
Everflame Seed.desc:
A seed that fuels the unending flames of the Pyro Regisvine. It emits Pyro energy as if it will burn all that has ever sprouted from the ground.
Endless desires flow among turbulent energy deep within the earth. What desire could steadily hold such fire to the plants and long so eagerly to bathe everything in unquenchable flames?

Cleansing Heart.name: Cleansing Heart
Cleansing Heart.desc:
A palmful of eternal water left by an oceanid.
Though it has already diffused among the depths of the lake, its purity remains all the same. But why would a creature so pure and clean as an oceanid covet the appearance of a being that roams the land, and assume such a form with pure water? They need not breathe nor do they require sustenance...

Juvenile Jade.name: Juvenile Jade
Juvenile Jade.desc:
A crystalline substance taken from a Primo Geovishap. Within it is contained the potential to become a dragon.
These dull crystals are precipitated within the bodies of vishaps sleeping in the mountains. Liyue folklore holds that they will gather power over many years, after which this crystal will, at last, replace their original heart, and the vishap will become a true dragon â€” one that can shake the mountains and split the earth.

Crystalline Bloom.name: Crystalline Bloom
Crystalline Bloom.desc:
An ice crystal of exceeding purity that is created in the frigid blooming of a Cryo Hypostasis.
These frosty crystals will continue to grow according to their own cold, rigid laws, till one day a flower of winter shall bloom and freeze everything. Perhaps it is stagnant time, that never-thawing bosom, that is the essence of this undying flower.

Marionette Core.name: Marionette Core
Marionette Core.desc:
This core can power the inorganic Maguu Kenki and cause it to wield a blade like a living being.
Flesh decays, and with it decay all martial arts mastery and all poignant memories.
Perhaps only by converting one's four limbs and body into sturdy mechanical parts, and by at last sacrificing one's very own heart for a sophisticated mechanical one, can one transcend the impermanence of the fleshly form...

Perpetual Heart.name: Perpetual Heart
Perpetual Heart.desc:
The core that powers the autonomous movements of the Perpetual Mechanical Array.
Some theorize that the symbols on these cores have knowledge and logic inscribed upon them in a language that eyes cannot perceive. Some go a step further and believe that these unique Ruin machines autonomously decided to forsake a biomimetic form to pursue strength of function on account of their especially large cores and complex inscriptions.
sources: Dropped by Lv. 30+ Perpetual Mechanical Arrays

Smoldering Pearl.name: Smoldering Pearl
Smoldering Pearl.desc:
A crystallization of a Pyro Hypostasis that constantly emits heat.
Even the burning flames shall one day grow cold, and even the ashen firewood can will itself back into a raging blaze. It must then be the will of the world that Pyro Hypostases should constantly cool down and heat up, much like the universe teems with endless life... until the fated darkness shall one day descend and bring it all to naught.

Dew of Repudiation.name: Dew of Repudiation
Dew of Repudiation.desc:
A strange water droplet left behind by the collapse of the Hydro Hypostasis.
It has strong rejection properties, and this forms the basis of one of the Hydro Hypostasis' attack patterns as well. They say that water contains memories and willpower, and that these things can grow when bodies of water meld together. However, the waves conjured by the Hydro Hypostasis are incompatible with the currents that flow above and below ground. Even if it were to flow into the surpassingly pure waters of Petrichor, this drop of water will likely resist assimilation as strongly as mercury.

Storm Beads.name: Storm Beads
Storm Beads.desc:
Crackling Electro pearls left behind by the Thunder Manifestation.
It is said that Thunder Manifestations will only descend upon lands where powerful hatred dwells. The singers say that it is the unbearable disappointments and sufferings of life that drive them to forever wander the broken earth, unleashing sky-searing lightning as they go.

Riftborn Regalia.name: Riftborn Regalia
Riftborn Regalia.desc:
A broken horn that you obtained from defeating the Wolflord. That said, it should not have left anything behind after your hunt.
Even a lord among the Riftwolves is nothing before monsters of a higher pedigree.
"Gold" mass-produced these malformed wolf packs almost as if by accident, like shrunken drawings on discarded sheets of paper, and the horns on this one represent its authority to command its dark brood to dissolve space itself.

Dragonheir's False Fin.name: Dragonheir's False Fin
Dragonheir's False Fin.desc:
A piece of biological tissue that you found after defeating the Bathysmal Vishaps.
